senses.de: To change position to a higher place; ascend.
senses.ex: He moved up the ladder rung by rung.
cl: move up to the next level

Tips.title: Physical movement
Tips.description: Describes ascending to a higher physical location.
Tips.example: The climber moved up the steep cliff face.

Tips.title: Career advancement
Tips.description: Refers to progressing to a higher position in a company or organization.
Tips.example: She quickly moved up the corporate ladder.

Tips.title: Ranking or level increase
Tips.description: Indicates an increase in rank, level, or status.
Tips.example: The team moved up several spots in the league standings.

senses.de: To bring forward or reschedule something to an earlier time or date.
senses.ex: They decided to move up the meeting to tomorrow.

Tips.title: Rescheduling
Tips.description: Indicates bringing an event forward to an earlier time.
Tips.example: We moved up our flight due to the impending storm.

ascend.wordDefinition: 'Ascend' implies a more formal or deliberate upward movement, often suggesting effort or progress.  'Move up' is more general and can be used in more casual contexts.

rise.wordDefinition: 'Rise' suggests a more gradual or natural upward movement, often without specific effort.  'Move up' implies a more deliberate action by a subject.

advance.wordDefinition: 'Advance' often implies progress or improvement, especially in rank or position. 'Move up' can be more general and may not always carry the same connotation of progress.
